intro: Euphorbia herniariifolia var. herniariifolia, commonly known as the leafless spurge, is a succulent plant native to the Canary Islands. It is characterized by its distinctive, fleshy, cylindrical stems that are often tinged with red or purple. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters, which are surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it suitable for arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and hardy nature, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
